page.title: 15INTERVIEW WITH FARMER
page.content: {MR. STEWART OF CABBAGEHALL FARM}has been farming here for 15 years and is the second generation to have farmed here. The present farmhouse is 12 years old. Farming is mixed arable and the crops are cereals: mostly barley, some wheat, potatoes and turnips. Wheat is most profitable. The outdoor life of farming appeals to Mr. Stewart. His farm is 284 acres. He enjoys bowling as a leisure activity. He feels there will be big changes in farming in the future; farms could be merged into larger units and machinery will become larger. This is a good area to farm because soil and weather conditions are satisfactory. He feels his life is pleasant and expects his family to farm; his wife is involved in the running of the business too.
